results.title: Mirror of Germany. No. 301 = Deutschland Spiegel
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mirror of Germany. The German Scene = Deutschland Spiegel”.
One of a series of magazine films depicting various aspects of West Germany. A focus on children in West Germany, and their place in society. Looks at opportunities for recreation, children and road safety, health, education, including that for handicapped children, hospital care, family assistance to enable children to have holidays, or planned activities.

results.title: Mirror of Germany. No. 299 = Deutschland Spiegel
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mirror of Germany. The German Scene = Deutschland Spiegel”.
One of a series of magazine films depicting various aspects of Germany. Looks at the popularity of jogging, a festival of African and Asian art in Berlin, an international Horticultural Show in Bonn, the integration of resettlers from Poland, the Lufthansa Service Centre for overhauling jets, and the district of East Friesland.

results.title: Mirror of Germany. No. 298 = Deutschland Spiegel
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mirror of Germany. The German Scene = Deutschland Spiegel”.
One of a series of magazine films depicting various aspects of Germany. Looks at the new State President, Berlin’s new Congress Centre, the Episcopal town of Fulda, bentwood furniture, the Hibernia School, where students are trained simultaneously for university and profession, and a European Cup final of Seven-a-side hardball.

results.title: Geraldton
results.creator_credit: Christopher McCullough, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life in Australia”.
Geraldton, Western Australia, is a fast developing town as it is the major supply centre and port of the north of the state. A glimpse of the people, industries, such as building and crayfishing, and social life of Geraldton.

results.title: George Bernard Shaw
results.creator_credit: Jan Read, Theodora Olembert and Triangle Productions
results.brief_description: Using newsreel interviews and conversation with such people as Dame Sybil Thorndike and Kingsley Martin the film presents the personality of Shaw, the social critic whose plays cast a brilliant light on the political ideas struggling for expression at the turn of the century. Commentary by John van Eyssen and Tony Quinn.

results.title: A Geometry lesson
results.creator_credit: Virgilio Sabel, Carlo Ponti and Lux Film
results.brief_description: This Italian art film traces a relationship between the shapes of nature and the modern sculpture of the Henry Moore school. The film considers the geometrical lines of nature - the shapes and lines of the human body, the structure of crystals and the spiral lines of a snail’s shell - a combination of calculation and creative impulse. Art, by dint of instinct, approaches nature’s examples, thus widening the range of our eyes and our minds. (Award: Venice)

results.title: Geologist and geophysicist
results.creator_credit: Career Productions and Mutual Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
A vocational guidance film designed to show the work of the geologist and geophysicist. Explains the university study required, and shows the application to work in mineral exploration, and other fields.

results.title: Geography of South America: the continent
results.brief_description: The main geographical features of South America, including the Andes, the Guiana and Brazilian highlands, and the Orinoco, Amazon and Plata-Parana River Basions. The relationships of these geographic factors to the people and their ways of life. Survey of agriculture, industry, commerce, cities and culture.

results.title: Geography of South America: Brazil
results.brief_description: The geographic features of Brazil and their relationship to such important crops as coffee, cotton and cacao; Brazil as a land of impenetrable jungle, fertile farmlands, gigantic plantations, rich mineral resources, thriving industry and big cities. Includes a sequence on Brasilia, the new capital.
